alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 9:33PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of southeastern Mineral and southern Missoula Counties through 1015 PM MST... At 933 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from near Evaro to 8 miles south of Tarkio. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 near mile marker 77, and between mile markers 88 and 110. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 7. Highway 93 S between mile markers 86 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 11, and between mile markers 28 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
